description: Construction of a new public corridor through the currently disused Downside (South-Eastern) Booking Hall, to provide lift access on the south-east side of Surbiton Station. Widening of an existing side entrance to allow wheelchair access and replacement of the non-original door and the canopy above. Improvement of step-free access to the station and platforms.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: BSWN Name: Borough Strategic Walking Network
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to the commencement of the works to which this consent relates to, detailed drawings of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:- Plans and elevations of new service runs and any necessary Builders Works In Connection - ifthey penetrate any existing walls / floorsThe development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and safeguard the historic and special architectural interest of the listed building on completion of the works, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the works to which this consent relates to, a detailed method statement and a schedule of works addressing how damage will be limited to areas of high significance (i.e. the Southern ticket hall and booking office) in the course of the works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The required Statement and Schedule of Works must demonstrate how any potential impacts to areas of high significance will be mitigated/eliminated.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and safeguard the historic interest and special architectural integrity of the listed building on completion of the works, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the works to which this permission relates to, samples of the materials and finish to be utilised in the works to which this permission relates including samples and specification for external doors (illustrating suitability in relation to existing eastern entrance door) and external signage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and safeguard the historic interest and special architectural integrity of the listed building on completion of the works, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the installation of any CCTV and Lighting relating to the works to which this consent relates to, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to their installation. Any CCTV and Lighting must only be installed in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and safeguard the historic interest and special architectural integrity of the listed building on completion of the works, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
